question: I care for my uncle who is 83 years old. His physician was cocnerned about his last lab work.  Bilrubin levels have gone from 0.9 in July of 2006 to 1.3 in March 2007 and then 1.4 last July.  His physician is concerned because tit appears to be steadily increasing.  Also the phosphatase (I don't think I have that spelled correctly) level has gone from 27 in March 2007, to 21 in July 2007.  The physician indiciated that these two levels indicate possible liver disease. My questions are:1.  What are the possible liver concerns?  tumors, benign or cancerous, cysts, hepatitis, other possibilities?2.  Do these lab results warrant enough concern to have the situation checked further?3.  What type of a specialist would we go to for this type of issue?4.  What type of screening procedures might be recommended?My uncle has early stage, mild dementia and becomes very upset by any type of change or possible medicle problems.  I am trying to weigh the possible risks, against putting him through further tests and procedures.  Is this something that should be pursued, or not significant enough to tackle at this time.  Would it be wise to wait and see what lab work looks like in six months?He has Diabetes Type II controlled well by meds and diet.  He takes Nemenda, Lipitor and Glucophage.  He had colon cancer in the 1980's, no cancer since that time.  No history of seizures, or heart problems.  He was an occassional social drinker, but stopped drinking 20 years ago..  Smoked earlier in his life, but stopped smoking thirty years ago.
title: Possible liver problems??
